channel.title: IPod VPS
channel.description:
I was reading Pokemonn's tutorial on how to play RSPS' on your iPad and I noticed in the comments it said you could use it as a VPS in the same way, would anyone know how I can do this ? It operates off Linux I believe and I don't know how to change all that batch files to suit Linux and what version of JDK would I download ?
P.S: I don't think this is in the correct section but I couldn't think of any other topics to put it in. Please move this to the correct thread if it isn't already

item.title: IPod VPS
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I read it as, nothing Apple releases is capable of running Linux by default. Was going to point towards the Mac, but it’s clear you didn’t mean that now

Read full topic

item.title: IPod VPS
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“nsfpure, post:3, topic:400856”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=497912.msg3641512#msg3641512 date=1309038650]
Nothing Apple releases runs Linux by default, but just about all of them can be made to run Linux, if you install Linux on your iDevice, then you can run any Linux program on it, and use it like any computer/server you like.
[/quote]

I know this and I have adapted my iDevice to run Linux. Please read Pokemonn’s tut before replying to this[/quote]

You haven’t linked to ‘Pokemonn’s tut’ and, of course, a google about the subject gets me endless pokemon threads.

[quote=“tL, post:4, topic:400856”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=497912.msg3641512#msg3641512 date=1309038650]
Nothing Apple releases runs Linux by default, but just about all of them can be made to run Linux, if you install Linux on your iDevice, then you can run any Linux program on it, and use it like any computer/server you like.
[/quote]

Nothing?[/quote]
As far as I know, yes. Does anything Apple releases come by default with Linux on it?

Read full topic

item.title: IPod VPS
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

You’d need remote desktop access on your VPS.
(As far as I’m aware).

Read full topic

item.title: IPod VPS
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Just connect to your other computer or vps using VNC on your iPad. Simples.

Yes it’s a horrible way of doing it, but it ensures that it will run completely smoothly since the iPad doesn’t have to do any of processing (well just receiving the image)

Read full topic

Nothing Apple releases runs Linux by default, but just about all of them can be made to run Linux, if you install Linux on your iDevice, then you can run any Linux program on it, and use it like any computer/server you like.
